10:06 <cjd> hi guys, I'm a little confused with the ComponentManagerManager usage  
10:06 <cjd> https://ezcrypt.it/7G8n#ld3oZ9hF3S5GwbqaNgAP2rxe  
10:07 <cjd> I use this script and it's giving me null (wikione is a subwiki)  
10:09 <DarkKnightCZ> cjd: what about services.component.getComponentManager().getInstance(ComponentManagerManager.class); ?  
10:09 <cjd> ahh I found the issue  
10:10 <cjd> it has to be 'wiki:wikione' rather than just the name of the wiki  
10:10 <DarkKnightCZ> i mean ClassYouWant.class... i'm not sure if you can obtain wiki as component  
10:10 <cjd> seems to be "wiki:" (literally) concatinated with the subwiki (or main wiki) name  
10:10 <cjd> cm = cmm.getComponentManager('wiki:' + 'xwiki', false);   <-- fixed  
10:15 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:18 <vmassol> Denis: would be great if you could update http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Roadmaps/WebHome for signed script part :)  
10:18 <vmassol> Denis: could you give us a very quick status for signed script for 6.1?  
10:27 <DarkKnightCZ> if i want to modify slides width generated by office macro, is it enough to modify impress\_html\_export, or do i have to modify every single extension?  
10:32 <DarkKnightCZ> ok, it's enough

13:28 <DarkKnightCZ> what would be the proper way of programmatically set user avatar? i've tried userxobject.setStringValue("avatar", "name of attachment"), but that just seems to do nothing  
13:31 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki

13:44 <DarkKnightCZ> xwiki.saveDocument?  
13:57 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
14:36 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
15:31 <Denis> has quit  
15:39 <tmortagne1> has joined #xwiki  
15:39 <tmortagne> has quit  
15:44 <mflorea> tmortagne: quick question (too lazy to check :) ) if I have a component A that extends an abstract class B, can I used @inject in B? I guess not, but I want to check  
15:45 <vmassol> mflorea: hmmm… I think so… but would need to check our code :)  
15:45 <vmassol> but  
15:45 <vmassol> it's a strange use case  
15:46 <vmassol> ah wait  
15:46 <vmassol> I misread  
15:46 <vmassol> if you're talking about class fields  
15:46 <mflorea> well, I have two components, that extend a base class, and I want to move some shared deps in the base class  
15:46 <vmassol> then yes it works  
15:46 <mflorea> yes, class fields  
15:47 <mflorea> the base class is abstract and doesn't have @Component  
15:48 <vmassol> that'll work, we use that often  
15:48 <vmassol> @Component should be put on top classes anyway  
15:48 <tmortagne1> has quit  
15:49 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
15:51 <mflorea> ok, thanks  
15:56 <tmortagne> mflorea: we have tons of abstract with @Inject in it  
15:56 <mflorea> ok :) thanks  
15:56 <tmortagne> if you use a logger make sure to put it in the abstract as protected  
15:57 <mflorea> yep  
15:57 <tmortagne> if you make it private in the abstract and make it private also with the same field name in and extends it's going to be null in the abstract  
15:57 <mflorea> ok, good to know  
15:57 <vmassol> it's a bug that we need to fix...  
15:57 <tmortagne> i.e. the CM does not see it when it's overriden  
15:58 <tmortagne> it's not an easy fix, the main issue being that the descriptor itself does not indicate in which class is the field to inject  
15:59 <tmortagne> we just have the top level class and the field name  
15:59 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit

17:03 <Slashman> Hello, I need to upload a file on a xwiki 6.0.1 instance that weight more than 400MB, I suppose the default parameters will not allow that, could someone point me to the correct settings to allow that?  
17:04 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
17:05 <Slashman> ok nervermind, I found it  
17:10 <Lyes1> has quit  
17:36 <evalica> has quit  
17:41 <webczat> I'm probably going to make the ldap sync module, but what to do if new configurable things will have to be added?  
17:54 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
18:00 <vmassol> has quit  
18:09 <mflorea> has quit  
18:11 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
18:12 <ClemensR> If the configureable things come in via XWikiPreferences maybe one can have a DocumentUpdatedEvent listening for changes in the config (or would that be overkill?)  
18:12 <webczat> mhmm  
18:12 <webczat> Probably not.  
18:17 <ClemensR> if folks set this in the xwiki.cfg, they need a server restart anyway and are maybe expected to do a "full resync" manually, anyway  
18:20 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
18:25 <kaisen> Maybe on stupid question, but how can I prove where my "perfomance" bottleneck is, when I open a xwiki page?  
18:29 <ClemensR> not stupid ... there are a lot of options where preformance can go  
18:30 <kaisen> I know that if I have a lot of changes on pages the activity stream takes a while  
18:30 <ClemensR> first step is to replace "/view/" by "/get/" and see if the problem remains  
18:31 <kaisen> Where should I place that and what does it indicate  
18:31 <ClemensR> then you see if it is the content on the page or some panels etc ...  
18:31 <ClemensR> ah, in the URL  
18:32 <ClemensR> the /xwiki/bin/view/...  -> /xwiki/bin/get/...  
18:32 <kaisen> ahh ok  
18:34 <kaisen> and if the perfomance is different I know that to draw a panel etc. is the problem?  
18:35 <kaisen> if the speed is the same I can check somehow the MySQL Database?  
18:45 <ClemensR> well, if speed is the same, is is the actual content in the page, and not some decoration .... but it could be that either the mySQL DB is slow or XWiki does something complicated server side  
18:46 <ClemensR> but anyway, from there you can edit the page and remove elements to see what part makes the page slow  ... and from what I have heard the activity stream is a good guess to start with  
18:47 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
18:48 <OSIMasson> has quit  
18:48 <kaisen> ok, I will play around  
18:51 <tmortagne> yes activity stream is pretty slow  
18:52 <tmortagne> (it can end up doing tons of database request when there is lots of changes)  
18:53 <kaisen> so the only way is to limit the activity stream or make the database fast?  
18:53 <tmortagne> not really sure how to make the activity stream fact actually  
18:54 <tmortagne> s/fact/fast/  
18:55 <kaisen> yes - fast  
18:55 <kaisen> I think is now time for me to go home and don't wast your time :)  
18:58 <kaisen> have a good evening  
18:58 <kaisen> bye  
18:58 <kaisen> has quit

21:20 <webczat> Is it possible to completely replace user management in xwiki? I wanted to make xwiki to ldap sync, but there may always be situation where xwiki is out of sync.  
21:22 <webczat> Like xwiki may immediately change a ldap directory when user changes. But it cannot detect ldap changes and use them to change users in xwiki unless the user logs in.  
21:23 <webczat> No problem except syncing groups. If I would like to be able to sync membership of groups to ldap it is okay, but if this is changed ldap side...  
21:25 <webczat> I believe the task is complicated to get it right, at least in the case of distributing it as an extension.  
21:28 <webczat> For example: syncing group members may or may not work. What if someone would like to use xwiki to manage groups like create and delete them? doable but incompatible with ldap authentication that is given group to ldap map, unless tou would always need to update the map.  
21:28 <webczat> Actually group names don't map directly to ldap logically.
